headline.main: Is Tax Software Sophisticated Enough for Same-Sex Couples?

docs.abstract: Same-sex couples living in states that recognize their legal unions have more complicated tax situations. So does that mean their financial lives are too complicated to use tax preparation software?
docs.snippet: Same-sex couples living in states that recognize their legal unions have more complicated tax situations. So does that mean their financial lives are too complicated to use tax preparation software?

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans appeared to be divided over pressing for a vote any time soon on legislation to overturn President Obama’s policy requiring coverage of contraceptives for women.

headline.seo: In Senate, Contraception Policy Appears Set for Showdown
headline.main: Senate Nears Showdown on Contraception Policy
headline.print_headline: Senate Nears Showdown On Contraception Policy

docs.abstract: Senate Republicans appear to be divided over pressing for a vote any time soon on legislation to overturn Pres Obama’s policy requiring health insurance coverage of contraceptives for women.
docs.snippet: Republicans appeared to be divided over pressing for a vote any time soon on legislation to overturn President Obama’s policy requiring coverage of contraceptives for women.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A wave of mergers between Roman Catholic and secular hospitals is threatening to deprive women access to important reproductive services.
docs.abstract: Editorial urges state regulators to closely examine mergers between Roman Catholic and secular hospitals and use whatever powers they have to block those that diminish women's access to abortions, contraception and sterilization.
docs.snippet: A wave of mergers between Roman Catholic and secular hospitals is threatening to deprive women access to important reproductive services.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to an Op-Ed article, “Contraception, Against Conscience.”
